node.text:
“I find beauty, sometimes in unnoticed things, and sometimes in things that are not spectacular. I find beauty in clouds and the sun and light and faces. More than anything else, I think what's really beautiful is the human face and the human eye. Then I think beauty has entered the planet.” 

A Future Together, screening now on ferragamo.com

#AFutureTogether #FerragamoAW21

node.title: In conversation with director Wim Wenders

node.text:
Director Wim Wenders on finding inspiration for the film: “We wanted to be alive and fresh, so I thought of a love story. And to tell you the truth, I've seen so many love stories happen on my movie sets. I fell in love with my wife on a movie set 30 years ago. And I've counted the other day, I've caused about a dozen marriages that happened between people who got to know each other on my sets. So I'm an expert in love stories and film sets.” 

A Future Together, screening now on ferragamo.com

#AFutureTogether #FerragamoAW21

node.text:
“I think fashion has been a driving force in cinema. Cinema has pushed fashion and fashion has pushed cinema. So it's not a strange marriage, it's not an odd couple.” In Conversation with director Wim Wenders on fashion in film. 

#AFutureTogether #FerragamoAW21

node.text:
Is it a trailer for a futuristic film being released or the story of love unfolding behind the scenes? In a film within a film, can a series of chance encounters shooting on-screen, spark a real love story off-screen?

Directed by Wim Wenders
Starring Gaia Girace, Felix Sandman,
Kayako Higuchi, Tak Bengana, Amar Akway and Yeop Kim
Soundtrack: Frederick Sanchez
Creative Agency: MA+Creative
Photographer: Vito Fernicola 
DoP: Franz Lustig
1st AD: Luca Lucchesi
Editor: Toni Froschhammer 
Assistant Editor: Lucas Deschle 

Now screening on ferragamo.com

#AFutureTogether #FerragamoAW21

node.title: A Future Together by Wim Wenders

node.text: Move to the rhythm of freedom with Let’s Dance, an invigorating new collection of shoes presented through the sublime art form of dance. Caught in a symbolic dialogue between fashion and dance, the film directed by American director Danielle Lessovitz brings to stage Anita Lorusso, Naomi Weijand and Tania Dimbelolo; three passionate and free dancers who embody the spirit of today’s women in a series of artfully stylized ensemble and solo performances in the fluidly flexible shoes. #FerragamoLetsDance

node.text:
Driven by environmental consciousness, the new F-80 Skeleton contributes towards the preservation of our oceans by using the post-consumer recycled PET (polyethylene terephthalate) fibre fabric. Discover more through the link in bio. ​

#FerragamoTime #FerragamoF80Skeleton

node.text:
Drawing inspiration from the abundant beauty of nature, Salvatore Ferragamo puts a contemporary spin on its most iconic pieces to honour its growing commitment to the use of low environmental impact materials. With the recent launch of the Sustainable Thinking platform, the Earth Top Handle and F-80 Skeleton watch are two new responsible additions to the house’s vision of a long-term commitment to the protection of the environment.​

#EarthTopHandle #FerragamoEarthBag #EarthDay

node.text:
Salvatore Ferragamo leaps forward to shape a new now. Inspired by the limitless conceptual freedom of science fiction and the house’s heritage of technical innovation, creative director Paul Andrew @paulandrewprivate projects into the future to craft an alternative vision for the present. 

Paul Andrew says: “In fashion, the past exerts a gravity - we are always drawn to it. For this season I wanted to invert that physics. The objective was to engineer a collection that sees the present through a prism of the future – unleashing a multitude of fresh perspectives. Pre-millennial sci-fi classics Gattaca, Until The End Of The World, and The Matrix were all cinematic influences - past imaginings of the future that have shaped today.
#FerragamoAW21

node.text:
Cut directly by Oscar-nominated director Luca Guadagnino from his atmospheric collection film, Salvatore Ferragamo’s campaign for Spring-Summer 2021 is a masterpiece of suspenseful refinement. The portfolio of stills and short video curated by Guadagnino alongside Salvatore Ferragamo Creative Director Paul Andrew draws from the Alfred Hitchcock inspired film, set in Milan, that was shown before the fashion show in September 2020. Conceived as both an homage to Hollywood — the site of our founder’s first success — and to Milan — the location of 21st Century Salvatore Ferragamo’s fashion expression — the campaign combines our heritage of artistic artisanship and technical innovation.

Starring @mariacarlaboscono @anokyai @chengmengge @samer._.1 and @jonasgloeer

node.title: Director's Cut - SS21 Ad Campaign by Luca Guadagnino

node.text:
Blinding lights, bright as the future unfolding before your very eyes. From cinematic master Wim Wenders and Salvatore Ferragamo, comes a story rife with glittering possibilities. Discover more through the link in bio. ⠀
 ⠀
A Future Together⠀
Directed by Wim Wenders⠀
Starring Gaia Girace and Felix Sandman⠀
Screening now at ferragamo.com⠀
 ⠀
#AFutureTogether #FerragamoAW21

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 12, 2021 tagging @seungjuuuuuuu. May be an image of 1 person.

node.text: Dreaming of Summer. Seungju Han adds a splash of colour to his casual-chic look with a silk twill scarf looped around the neck for an effortless elegance. #SilkYourStyle

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 12, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Twist of Style'.

node.text: Add a twist of style to everyday dressing, with a standout scarf accessory to spice up an off-duty ensemble. Discover more ways to #SilkYourStyle through the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 11, 2021 tagging @boon.vivant_. May be an image of 1 person, standing and suit.

node.text: Here Comes the Sun. Momo is ready for a summer of good times with a sunny suit ensemble complemented by a silk scarf looped through the neck for casual elegance. #SilkYourStyle

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 11, 2021 tagging @brittanybathgate. May be an image of 1 person and standing.

node.text: Draped in Elegance. Brittany Bathgate gracefully puts together the vivid ebullience of the Forresta print silk scarf with the muted austerity of a tonal white ensemble. #SilkYourStyle

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 10, 2021 tagging @nregge. May be an image of 1 person and text.

node.text: Dial up the old-school glamour with an elegant scarf worn in the hair, as seen on Natalia Regge with a vivacious print silk scarf from Salvatore Ferragamo. Discover more ways to #SilkYourStyle through the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 09, 2021 tagging @mm_mengmao. May be an image of 1 person.

node.text: Add a fluid feminine touch to vamp up everyday dressing with an elegant scarf for a hair tie. Meng Mao styles a Gancini and floral print silk scarf for effortless elegance. Learn more ways to style this sartorial saviour through the link in bio. #SilkYourStyle

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 09, 2021 tagging @kayan9896. May be an image of 1 person and standing.

node.text: Jeannie pairs it back to tailored separates for a chic 9-to-9 ensemble, spruced up with a vibrant Ferragamo silk scarf for a pop of colour. Discover many more ways to #SilkYourStyle through the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 08, 2021 tagging @kayan9896. May be an image of ‎1 person, standing and ‎text that says '‎5h Bohemian Chic ر‎'‎‎.

node.text: Jeannie is ready to embrace the summer spirit with a bohemian chic take on a Ferragamo silk foulard. Discover many more ways to style this timeless accessory through the link in bio.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Salvatore Ferragamo on August 08, 2021 tagging @andreafaccio. May be an image of 1 person and standing.

node.text: Andrea Faccio shows us how it's done with a casual summer look elevated through a silk scarf effortlessly styled around the collar of a crisp white shirt. Discover many more ways to #SilkYourStyle through the link in bio.

node.text:
Salvatore Ferragamo, Ortensie, Fall/Winter collection 2002–03, silk twill scarf.⠀
Museo Salvatore Ferragamo, Florence⠀
 ⠀
Fulvia Ferragamo drew inspiration from myriad sources while creating a vibrant bouquet of floral patchworks for her silk scarves. The maison’s shoes held sway over her imagination, in the form of the inventive shoe uppers made by her own father, founder Salvatore Ferragamo, who created a patchwork technique, sewing together small pieces of different leathers, often in contrasting colours. ⠀
 ⠀
#FerragamoSilkRoute #MuseoSalvatoreFerragamo

node.text:
Drawing for the Giada scarf, 1992, pencil and tempera on paper.⠀
Museo Salvatore Ferragamo, Florence⠀
 ⠀
Floral fantasies proliferated in the silk creations of Fulvia Ferragamo, opening up an eclectic world that has been preserved in the brand’s archive, a veritable Wunderkammer that reveals how the apparent simplicity of these silk prints, intended for worldly use, actually conceals great conceptual and productive complexity. Discover the world of silken wonder through a virtual tour of the exhibition in the link in bio. ⠀
 ⠀
#FerragamoSilkRoute #MuseoSalvatoreFerragamo
